definitions.definition: said, made or done very quickly, especially when this has bad results

examples.text: The army beat a hasty retreat.
Let's not make any hasty decisions.
She regretted her hasty words the moment she’d spoken.

definitions.definition: acting or deciding too quickly, without enough thought

examples.text: Perhaps I was too hasty in rejecting his offer.

definitions.definition: to go away or back quickly, especially to avoid something unpleasant

examples.text: I decided to beat a hasty retreat.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French hasti, hastif, from haste(noun), haster (verb), of Germanic origin.
